qas.question: Which color was said to be the Emperor's color in ancient Rome?
At what time were togas with red were worn by Romans?
What color was correlated with the Army in ancient Rome?
After what event would a general of the Roman army be painted red?
What was the color of the emperor in Ancient Tryian?
What are the red stripes on togas called?
What were the red tunics worn by Roman soldiers called?

plausible_answers.text: The vexilloid of the Roman Empire

qas.question: Where were the gold letters SQRP found?

context: In Ancient Rome, <a0_0>Tyrian <b5_0>purple<b5_0/><a0_0/> was the color of the Emperor, but red had an important religious symbolism. Romans wore togas with red stripes on <a1_0>holidays<a1_0/>, and the bride at a wedding wore <a2_0>a red shawl<a2_0/>, called a <b6_0>flammeum.<b6_0/> Red was used to color statues and the skin of gladiators. <a3_0>Red<a3_0/> was also the color associated with army; Roman soldiers wore red tunics, and officers wore a cloak called a <b7_0>paludamentum<b7_0/> which, depending upon the quality of the dye, could be crimson, scarlet or purple. In Roman mythology red is associated with the god of war, Mars. <b8_0>The vexilloid of the Roman Empire<b8_0/> had a red background with the letters SPQR in gold. A Roman general receiving a <a4_0>triumph<a4_0/> had his entire body painted red in honor of his achievement.
